intro: Leucosyke quadrinervia, commonly known as the four-veined milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with four distinct veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract various pollinators. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant contains milky sap, which can be toxic to some animals.
